trans-unit.source: Enable remote debugging with continuous delivery
trans-unit.target: Enable remote debugging with continuous delivery

trans-unit.source: Learn how to enable remote debugging when using continuous delivery to deploy to Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn how to enable remote debugging when using continuous delivery to deploy to Azure

trans-unit.source: You can enable remote debugging in Azure when you use <linkText>continuous delivery</linkText><title></title> to publish to Azure by following these steps.
trans-unit.target: You can enable remote debugging in Azure when you use <linkText>continuous delivery</linkText><title></title> to publish to Azure by following these steps.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enabling remote debugging for cloud services</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enabling remote debugging for cloud services</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enabling remote debugging for virtual machines</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enabling remote debugging for virtual machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: On the build agent, set up the initial environment for Azure as outlined in <linkText>Command-Line Build for Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: On the build agent, set up the initial environment for Azure as outlined in <linkText>Command-Line Build for Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Because the remote debug runtime (msvsmon.exe) is required for the package, install the <linkText>Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 RC</linkText><title></title> (or the <linkText>Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 RC</linkText><title></title> if you’re using Visual Studio 2013).
trans-unit.target: Because the remote debug runtime (msvsmon.exe) is required for the package, install the <linkText>Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2015 RC</linkText><title></title> (or the <linkText>Remote Tools for Visual Studio 2013 Update 5 RC</linkText><title></title> if you’re using Visual Studio 2013).

trans-unit.source: As an alternative, you can copy the remote debug binaries from a system that has Visual Studio installed.
trans-unit.target: As an alternative, you can copy the remote debug binaries from a system that has Visual Studio installed.

trans-unit.source: Create a certificate as outlined in <linkText>Create a Service Certificate for Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Create a certificate as outlined in <linkText>Create a Service Certificate for Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Keep the .pfx and RDP certificate thumbprint and upload the certificate to the target cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Keep the .pfx and RDP certificate thumbprint and upload the certificate to the target cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Use the following options in the MSBuild command line to build and package with remote debug enabled.
trans-unit.target: Use the following options in the MSBuild command line to build and package with remote debug enabled.

trans-unit.source: (Substitute actual paths to your system and project files for the angle-bracketed items.)
trans-unit.target: (Substitute actual paths to your system and project files for the angle-bracketed items.)

trans-unit.source: VSX64RemoteDebuggerPath is the path to the folder containing msvsmon.exe in the Remote Tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: VSX64RemoteDebuggerPath is the path to the folder containing msvsmon.exe in the Remote Tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Publish to the target cloud service by using the package and .cscfg file generated in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Publish to the target cloud service by using the package and .cscfg file generated in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Import the certificate (.pfx file) to the machine that has Visual Studio with Azure SDK for .NET installed.
trans-unit.target: Import the certificate (.pfx file) to the machine that has Visual Studio with Azure SDK for .NET installed.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Creating Azure Virtual Machines in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Creating Azure Virtual Machines in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the <linkText>Azure portal page</linkText><title></title>, view the virtual machine dashboard to see the virtual machine’s “RDP Certificate Thumbprint”.
trans-unit.target: On the <linkText>Azure portal page</linkText><title></title>, view the virtual machine dashboard to see the virtual machine’s “RDP Certificate Thumbprint”.

trans-unit.source: This is used for the ServerThumbprint value in the extension configuration.
trans-unit.target: This is used for the ServerThumbprint value in the extension configuration.

trans-unit.source: Create a client certificate as outlined in <linkText>Create a Service Certificate for Azure</linkText><title></title> (keep the .pfx and RDP certificate thumbprint).
trans-unit.target: Create a client certificate as outlined in <linkText>Create a Service Certificate for Azure</linkText><title></title> (keep the .pfx and RDP certificate thumbprint).

trans-unit.source: Install <linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title> (version 0.7.4 or later) from the Microsoft Download Center.
trans-unit.target: Install <linkText>Azure Powershell</linkText><title></title> (version 0.7.4 or later) from the Microsoft Download Center.

trans-unit.source: Run the following script to enable the RemoteDebug extension.
trans-unit.target: Run the following script to enable the RemoteDebug extension.

trans-unit.source: Replace the paths and personal data with your own, such as your subscription name, service name, and thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: Replace the paths and personal data with your own, such as your subscription name, service name, and thumbprint.

trans-unit.source: (NOTE: This script is configured for Visual Studio 2015 RC.
trans-unit.target: (NOTE: This script is configured for Visual Studio 2015 RC.

trans-unit.source: If you’re using Visual Studio 2013, use "RemoteDebugVS2013" for ReferenceName and ExtensionName.)
trans-unit.target: If you’re using Visual Studio 2013, use "RemoteDebugVS2013" for ReferenceName and ExtensionName.)

trans-unit.source: true
trans-unit.target: true

trans-unit.source: E7DCB00CB916C468CC3228261D6E4EE45C8ED3C6
trans-unit.target: E7DCB00CB916C468CC3228261D6E4EE45C8ED3C6

trans-unit.source:
"
$vm | Set-AzureVMExtension ` -ReferenceName $referenceName ` -Publisher $publisher ` -ExtensionName $extensionName ` -Version $version ` -PublicConfiguration $publicConfiguration
foreach($extension in $vm.VM.ResourceExtensionReferences) { if(($extension.ReferenceName -eq $referenceName) ` -and ($extension.Publisher -eq $publisher) ` -and ($extension.Name -eq $extensionName) ` -and ($extension.Version -eq $version)) { $extension.ResourceExtensionParameterValues[0].Key = 'config.txt' break } }
$vm | Update-AzureVM
trans-unit.target:
"
$vm | Set-AzureVMExtension ` -ReferenceName $referenceName ` -Publisher $publisher ` -ExtensionName $extensionName ` -Version $version ` -PublicConfiguration $publicConfiguration
foreach($extension in $vm.VM.ResourceExtensionReferences) { if(($extension.ReferenceName -eq $referenceName) ` -and ($extension.Publisher -eq $publisher) ` -and ($extension.Name -eq $extensionName) ` -and ($extension.Version -eq $version)) { $extension.ResourceExtensionParameterValues[0].Key = 'config.txt' break } }
$vm | Update-AzureVM

trans-unit.source: Import the certificate (.pfx) to the machine that has Visual Studio with Azure SDK for .NET installed.
trans-unit.target: Import the certificate (.pfx) to the machine that has Visual Studio with Azure SDK for .NET installed.
